alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Floyd; Hale; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 3:49PM CDT until June 02 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN LUBBOCK...SOUTHWESTERN FLOYD...NORTHWESTERN CROSBY AND SOUTHEASTERN HALE COUNTIES... At 348 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lorenzo, or 18 miles west of Crosbyton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 340 pm CDT, The West Texas Mesonet site near New Deal reported a 59 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Abernathy, Idalou, Ralls, Lockney, Petersburg, Lorenzo, Lubbock International Airport, Cone and New Deal. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
